array.string: After incrementing `index`, check if it’s equal to `animals.count`. If it is, set it back to `0`.

dict.string:
### Well done!
Remember that the index to an array starts at 0 and goes up to the array’s count minus 1. So if the index *equals* the count, the index has gone past the end of the array, and it’s time to set the index back to 0.
